text:
10.1016/j.jpowsour.2014.11.037
Phase composition and electrochemical performance of sodium lithium titanates as anode materials for lithium rechargeable batteries

NaxLi4-xTi6O14 (0 <= x <= 4) samples with different Na contents (x = 0, 1, 2, 3 and 4) were synthesized by a traditional solid-state method.

The stoichiometric amounts of CH3COOLi*2H2O (Aladdin Chemistry), CH3COONa*3H2O (Aladdin Chemistry), TiO2 (Aladdin Chemistry) were mixed with oxalic acid dehydrate chelating agent (Aladdin Chemistry) under various Na/Li molar ratios and pretreated by high energy ball-milling in ethanol at 400 rpm rotational speed for 15 h.
The obtained precursor slurry was dried at 80 degC and then calcinated at 900 degC for 10 h in air atmosphere.
